decks.notes: This deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and disruptive spells, while also utilizing powerful planeswalkers and versatile removal cards to control the board. By combining efficient threats like Tarmogoyf and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer with hand disruption and removal like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, cards like Wrenn and Six provide recurring value, while Nihil Spellbomb and Shadowspear offer graveyard hate and utility. Overall, the deck seeks to quickly close out games through a combination of speed, disruption, and resilience.

The deck revolves around assembling the Splinter Twin combo using Deceiver Exarch to create infinite token copies of a creature, boosting your board presence and overwhelming your opponent. The deck also includes various control elements such as counterspells and removal spells to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card advantage and card selection, while cards like Snapcaster Mage offer versatility and recursion. The deck aims to quickly set up the combo and control the game until it can secure the win.

The main strategy of this deck is to use ramp cards like Utopia Sprawl and Eldrazi Temple to accelerate into casting powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker. Control elements like Kozilek's Return and Karn, the Great Creator help control the board while also providing utility. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with massive threats while disrupting their game plan with removal and disruption spells. The goal is to establish a dominant board presence and close out the game quickly with the high-powered Eldrazi creatures.

The deck focuses on utilizing cascade cards like Shardless Agent to consistently cycle through the deck and get Living End into play, which allows the player to bring back all their creatures from the graveyard. The deck also includes creatures with disruptive abilities like Misty Rainforest and Endurance to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a powerful board presence and take control of the game through efficient creature recursion and disruption.

Control your opponent using artifacts and spells while setting up an engine with Urza and Emry to generate card advantage and create an army of Thopter tokens. Use Whir of Invention to tutor up key pieces like Sword of the Meek and Thopter Foundry, while keeping the opponent's threats at bay with Metallic Rebuke and Portable Hole. Urza's Saga provides additional value by searching for artifacts and providing tokens. Tamiyo helps with card selection and filtering, while Mox Opal and Mishra's Bauble help to ramp and draw cards respectively. The deck aims to outvalue and outpace the opponent in the mid to late game.

This Boros Aggro deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of aggressive creatures and burn spells. Showdown of the Skalds and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker provide card advantage and pump up the team, while Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury bring the beatdowns. Thraben Charm and Goblin Bombardment keep the opponent on their toes, while Static Prison locks down the opponent's threats. Guide of Souls and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah provide additional support and protection for the team. The deck aims to win quickly and decisively before the opponent can stabilize.
